title: drawingInfo
description: The drawingInfo object contains drawing information for a feature layer.

transparency.description: Number value ranging between 0 (no transparency) to 100 (completely transparent).

labelingInfo_schema.json.title: labelingInfo
labelingInfo_schema.json.description: The labelingInfo object specifies the label definition for a layer.

labelExpression.description: Defines the expression for text of labels. Deprecated on FeatureLayer, Use `labelExpressionInfo` instead.

labelPlacement.description: This string property specifies the label placement with respect to that of its feature. A list of label placement values categorized by feature geometry types.

maxScale.description: Represents the maximum scale at which the layer definition will be applied.

minScale.description: Represents the minimum scale at which the layer definition will be applied.

name.description: The name of the label class.

symbol.description: The text symbol used to label.

useCodedValues.description: Boolean value indicating whether to display the coded values for the specified field name(s).

where.description: String template used to determine which features to label.

labelExpressionInfo_schema.json.title: labelExpressionInfo
labelExpressionInfo_schema.json.description: The labelExpressionInfo allows label text to be read similar to that of Popups's description property.

expression.description: An [Arcade expression](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) evaluating to either a string or a number.

labelSymbol3D_schema.json.title: LabelSymbol3D
labelSymbol3D_schema.json.description: LabelSymbol3D is used to render labels for features from a FeatureLayer in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

examples.title: Label Symbol 3D with verticalOffset and leader line callout

size.description: The width of the line in points.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

type.description: The type of the callout. A callout of type `line` connects an offset symbol or label with its location.

border_schema.json.title: border
border_schema.json.description: Optional border on the line that is used to improve the contrast of the line color against various background colors.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

color_schema.json.title: color
color_schema.json.description: Color is represented as a three or four-element array. The four elements represent values for red, green, blue, and alpha in that order. Values range from 0 through 255. If color is undefined for a symbol, the color value is null.

textSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: TextSymbol3DLayer
textSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: Symbol layer for text and font definitions.

size.description: Font size in points, positive only

text.description: Text content in the label. Typically this property is not set, as text content is read from labeling field.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

size.description: The font size in points. Ignored when font is used on TextSymbol3DLayer.
Width of the halo in points.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

material_schema.json.title: Material
material_schema.json.description: The material used to shade the geometry.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity). Ignored if no color is specified.

verticalOffset_schema.json.title: verticalOffset
verticalOffset_schema.json.description: Shifts the symbol along the vertical world axis by a given length. The length is set in screen space units.

maxWorldLength.description: The maximum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as an upper bound to avoid lift becoming too big.

minWorldLength.description: The minimum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as a lower bound to avoid lift becoming too small.

screenLength.description: Maximal screen length of lift in points.

renderer_schema.json.title: renderer
renderer_schema.json.description: The renderer object contains the drawing information for the operationalLayer. This is a list of links to all the renderer objects.

classBreaksRenderer_schema.json.title: ClassBreaks Renderer
classBreaksRenderer_schema.json.description: A class breaks renderer symbolizes based on the value of some numeric attribute. The classBreakInfo define the values at which the symbology changes.

authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

defaultLabel.description: Label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

defaultSymbol.description: Symbol used when a value cannot be classified.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

minValue.description: The minimum numeric data value needed to begin class breaks.

normalizationField.description: Used when normalizationType is field. The string value indicating the attribute field by which the data value is normalized.

normalizationTotal.description: Used when normalizationType is percent-of-total, this number property contains the total of all data values.

normalizationType.description: Determine how the data was normalized.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

visualVariables.description: An array of objects used to set rendering properties.

authoringInfo_schema.json.title: authoringInfo
authoringInfo_schema.json.description: The authoringInfo is an object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via an authoring client, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it. Properties for color/size/transparency sliders, theme selection, classification information, and additional properties are saved within this object.

classificationMethod.description: Used for classed color or size. The default value is `esriClassifyManual`.

fields.description: An array of string values representing field names used for creating predominance renderers.

focus.description: Optional. Used for Relationship renderer. If not set, the legend will default to being square.

lengthUnit.description: Unit used in user interfaces to display world/map sizes and distances

numClasses.description: Number of classes to be associated with the relationship. Used for Relationship renderer.

standardDeviationInterval.description: Use this property if the classificationMethod is `esriClassifyStandardDeviation`.

visualVariables.description: An array of visualVariable objects containing additional information needed when authoring the renderer.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: The authoringInfo object is not required with a renderer. It is only used if rendering was generated using the Scene Viewer rendering tools. All snippets provided below show a portion of what is contained within `authoringInfo`. Please refer to the sample snippets in the [authoringInfo visual variable](authoringInfo_visualVariable.md) object for additional help.

colorRamp_schema.json.title: Color Ramp
colorRamp_schema.json.description: A colorRamp object is used to specify a range of colors that are applied to a group of symbols.

colorRamp_algorithmic_schema.json.title: Color Ramp Algorithmic
colorRamp_algorithmic_schema.json.description: A colorRamp object is used to specify a range of colors that are applied to a group of symbols.

algorithm.description: Algorithm used for calculating the ramp.

fromColor.description: Array representing the initial color to start the ramp from.

toColor.description: Array representing the final color to end the ramp with.

type.description: Value indicating the type of colorRamp.

colorRamp_multipart_schema.json.title: Color Ramp Multipart
colorRamp_multipart_schema.json.description: A colorRamp object is used to specify a range of colors that are applied to a group of symbols.

colorRamps.description: A multipart color ramp is defined by a list of constituent color ramps.

type.description: Value indicating the type of colorRamp.

field_authoringInfo_schema.json.title: AuthoringInfo Field
field_authoringInfo_schema.json.description: Contains information about an attribute field relating to Relationship renderers.

normalizationField.description: Attribute field used to normalize the data.

classBreakInfo_authoringInfo_schema.json.title: AuthoringInfo classBreakInfo
classBreakInfo_authoringInfo_schema.json.description: The classBreaksInfo object provides information about the class breaks associated with the Relationship renderer.

maxValue.description: A numeric value used to specify the maximum value for a break.

minValue.description: A numeric value used to specify the minimum value for a break.

authoringInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.title: AuthoringInfo Visual Variable
authoringInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.description: This visual variable pertains specifically to [authoringInfo](authoringInfo.md) and is different from visual variables directly on the [renderer](renderer.md).

endTime.description: A Unix stamp. Both `startTime` or `endTime` can be fields. If this is the case, their names must be different.

field.description: The attribute field the user chose in the Smart Mapping gallery. Must be the same as in either `startTime` or `endTime`.

maxSliderValue.description: A numeric value indicating the maximum value displayed.

minSliderValue.description: A numeric value indicating the minimum value displayed.

startTime.description: A Unix time stamp. Both `startTime` or `endTime` can be fields. If this is the case, their names must be different.

style.description: (This property is used for comparison rendering). It is used to map the ratio between two numbers. It is possible to express that relationship as percentages, simple ratios, or an overall percentage.

theme.description: Theme to be used only when working with visual variables of type `colorInfo`. Default is `high-to-low`.

type.description: A string value specifying the type of renderer's visual variable.

units.description: (This property is used only with age renderers.) Units for startTime and endTime.

examples.title: Attribute Transparency
examples.description: Allows displaying features with different levels of opacity.

examples.title: Continuous Size Renderer
examples.description: If a layer contains date values, it is possible to use a sequence of proportional symbols to view dates sequentially on a scene.

examples.title: Continuous Color Renderer
examples.description: If a layer contains date values, it is possible to use color to view data sequentially from new to old or before and after a key date.

examples.title: Age-Size Renderer
examples.description: If a layer contains date or time values, it is possible to use a sequence of proportional symbols to view the age of features. Age reflects the length of time (in seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, or years) from a start date or time to an end date or time.

examples.title: Age-Color Renderer
examples.description: If a layer contains date or time values, it is possible to use color to represent the age of features. Age reflects the length of time (in seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, or years) from a start date or time to an end date or time.

examples.title: Compare Renderer (special color renderer)
examples.description: This style allows mapping the ratio between two numbers and expresses that relationship as percentages, simple ratios, or overall percentage.

examples.title: Predominance Renderer
examples.description: This style uses transparency to show the relative strength of the predominant attribute for each feature in the layer. The strength, or degree, of predominance is calculated as a percentage of the total value of all the attributes for a given feature.

polygonSymbol3D_schema.json.title: PolygonSymbol3D
polygonSymbol3D_schema.json.description: PolygonSymbol3D is used to render features with Polygon geometry in a 3D SceneView. Polygon features may also be rendered as points with icons or objects at the centroid of each polygon.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

styleOrigin_schema.json.title: styleOrigin
styleOrigin_schema.json.description: The origin of the style from which the symbol was originally referenced. A reference to the style origin can be either by styleName or by styleUrl (but not both). It may be used to understand where a symbol was originally sourced from, but does not affect actual appearance or rendering of the symbol.

name.description: Identifies a symbol in the style by name.

styleName.description: A registered web style name, such as `EsriThematicShapesStyle`

fillSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: FillSymbol3DLayer
fillSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: FillSymbol3DLayer is used to render the surfaces of flat 2D Polygon geometries and 3D volumetric meshes in a SceneView.

castShadows.description: Boolean to control the shadow casting behaviour of the rendered geometries.

edges.description: Specifies an edge visualization style. Only affects MeshSymbol3D.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

edges_schema.json.title: Edges
edges_schema.json.description: Edges describe additional styles applied to visually important edges of 3D objects.

sketchEdges_schema.json.title: Sketch Edges
sketchEdges_schema.json.description: The sketch edge rendering configuration of a symbol layer. Edges of type `sketch` are rendered with a hand-drawn look in mind.

extensionLength.description: A size in points by which to extend edges beyond their original end points.

size.description: Edge size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

type.description: The type of edge visualization.

solidEdges_schema.json.title: Solid Edges
solidEdges_schema.json.description: The solid edge rendering configuration of a symbol layer. Edges of type `solid` are rendered in a single color, unaffected by scene lighting.

extensionLength.description: A size in points by which to extend edges beyond their original end points.

size.description: Edge size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

type.description: The type of edge visualization.

materialColorMixMode_schema.json.title: Material
materialColorMixMode_schema.json.description: The material used to shade the geometry, including colorMixMode options.

colorMixMode.description:
Controls how symbolLayer or visualVariable color is applied onto the underlying geometry color/texture. This property only applies to FillSymbol3DLayer within MeshSymbol3D.
  • `tint`: the feature's appearance (in terms of color) should be altered to match the symbol / visual variable color.
  • `replace`: the feature's color is replaced with the symbol / visual variable color.
  • `multiply`: the feature's color is multiplied with the symbol color.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity). Ignored if no color is specified.

outline_schema.json.title: Outline
outline_schema.json.description: The outline of the symbol layer.

size.description: Outline size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

extrudeSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer
extrudeSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer is used to render Polygon geometries by extruding them upward from the ground, creating a 3D volumetric object.

castShadows.description: Boolean to control the shadow casting behaviour of the rendered geometries.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

waterSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: WaterSymbol3DLayer
waterSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: Symbol Layer that describes a water appearance on surfaces in a SceneView.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

waterbodySize.description: Size of the waterbody the symbol layer represents. Applications will display waves that are appropriate for the chosen body of water, for example ocean versus marina versus swimming pool.

waveDirection.description: Azimuthal bearing for direction of the waves. If ommitted, waves appear directionless. The value is interpreted as 'geographic' rotation, i.e. clockwise starting from north.

waveStrength.description: The magnitude of the waves displayed on the waterbody. Strings roughly follow the [Douglas sea scale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_sea_scale), currently limited to lower degrees.

iconSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: IconSymbol3DLayer
iconSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: IconSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a flat 2D icon (e.g. a circle) with a PointSymbol3D in a SceneView.

anchorPosition.description: When `anchor` equals `relative`, this property specifies the position within the icon that should coincide with the feature geometry. Otherwise it is ignored. The position is defined as a factor of the icon dimensions that is added to the icon center: `positionInIcon = (0.5 + anchorPosition) * size`, where `size` is the original size of the icon resource.

size.description: Icon size in points, positive only

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

examples.title: Icon symbol layer with custom anchor in the bottom right region of the icon

iconSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.title: IconSymbol3DLayer Resource
iconSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.description: The shape (primitive) or image URL (href) used to visualize the features.

dataURI.description: an image encoded as base64 string, starting with `data:image/`

primitive.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

objectSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: ObjectSymbol3DLayer
objectSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: ObjectSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a volumetric 3D shape (e.g., a sphere or cylinder) with a Symbol3D in a SceneView.

anchor.description: The positioning of the object relative to the geometry.

anchorPosition.description: When `anchor` equals `relative`, this property specifies the positioning of the object relative to the geometry as a fraction of the symbol layer's bounding box. Otherwise it is ignored.

castShadows.description: Boolean to control the shadow casting behaviour of the rendered geometries.

depth.description: Object depth in meters, positive only

heading.description: Rotation angle around Z axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model points in the direction of the Y-axis. Positive values indicate clockwise rotation (when looked at from the top). [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

height.description: Object height in meters, positive only

roll.description: Rotation angle around Y axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the left part and lowers the right part of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

tilt.description: Rotation angle around X axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the front and lowers the back of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

width.description: Object width in meters, positive only

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
- [Size property interaction](static/objectSymbolLayerSize.md)
- [Anchor and `origin`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-ObjectSymbol3DLayer.html#anchor) in ArcGIS API for JavaScript.

examples.title: Object symbol layer with relative anchor
examples.description: Places a diamond symbol such that its Southern tip coincides with the point geometry (assuming ENU coordinates).

examples.title: Object symbol layer with casting shadows disabled

objectSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.title: ObjectSymbol3DLayer Resource
objectSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.description: The primitive shape (primitive) or external 3D model (href) used to visualize the points.

lineSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: LineSymbol3DLayer
lineSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: LineSymbol3DLayer renders Polyline geometries using a flat 2D line with a LineSymbol3D in a 3D SceneView.

cap.description: Shape of the beginning and the end of each line geometry.

join.description: Shape of the intersection of two line segments.

size.description: Line width in points, positive only

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

classBreakInfo_schema.json.title: classBreakInfo
classBreakInfo_schema.json.description: The classBreaksInfo object provides information about the class breaks associated with the renderer.

classMaxValue.description: A numeric value used to specify the maximum value for a break.

classMinValue.description: A numeric value used to specify discontinuous class breaks. If this value is null or is missing, the map server will calculate the minimum value based on the preceding class' maximum value.

description.description: String value used to describe the drawn symbol.

label.description: String value used to label the drawn symbol.

symbol.description: An object used to display the value.

symbol3D_schema.json.title: Symbol3D
symbol3D_schema.json.description: Symbol3D is the base class for all 3D symbols. It is used to render 2D Point, Polyline, and Polygon features in a FeatureLayer and 3D mesh features in a SceneLayer. All 3D symbols must be used in a SceneView instance; there is no support for 3D rendering in MapViews.

lineSymbol3D_schema.json.title: LineSymbol3D
lineSymbol3D_schema.json.description: LineSymbol3D is used to render features with Polyline geometry in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

pathSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: PathSymbol3DLayer
pathSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: PathSymbol3DLayer renders polyline geometries by extruding a 2D profile along the line, resulting in visualizations like tubes, walls, etc.

anchor.description: The position of the extrusion profile with respect to the polyline geometry.

cap.description: Shape of the beginning and the end of each line geometry.

castShadows.description: Boolean to control the shadow casting behaviour of the rendered geometries.

height.description: Path height in meters. If unspecified, it is equal to `width`.

join.description: Shape of the intersection of two line segments.

profile.description: The shape which is extruded along the line.

profileRotation.description: Specifies the axes about which the profile may be rotated at the joins. Constraining the rotation axes leads to a fixed orientation of the profile for the specified directions.

size.description: Path size (diameter) in meters. Ignored if either `width` or `height` are present.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

width.description: Path width in meters. If unspecified, it is equal to `height`.

meshSymbol3D_schema.json.title: MeshSymbol3D
meshSymbol3D_schema.json.description: MeshSymbol3D is used to render 3D mesh features in a SceneLayer in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used

pointSymbol3D_schema.json.title: PointSymbol3D
pointSymbol3D_schema.json.description: PointSymbol3D is used to render features with Point geometry in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used

examples.title: Icon Point Symbol with verticalOffset and leader line callout

styleSymbolReference_schema.json.title: StyleSymbolReference
styleSymbolReference_schema.json.description: The StyleSymbolReference is used to reference a symbol from a portal styleItem

name.description: Identifies a symbol in the style by name.

styleName.description: A registered web style name, such as `EsriThematicTreesStyle`

type.description: The type of the symbol

rendererLegendOptions_schema.json.title: Renderer Legend Options
rendererLegendOptions_schema.json.description: Options available for the renderer legend.

visualVariable_schema.json.title: visualVariable
visualVariable_schema.json.description: An object used to set rendering options. Please see the individual visual variable for specific information on how it is used.

colorInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.title: ColorInfo Visual Variable
colorInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.description: The colorInfo visual variable defines how a continuous color ramp is applied to features based on the values of a numeric field attribute.

field.description: Attribute field used for color rendering if no valueExpression is provided.

normalizationField.description: Attribute field used to normalize the data.

type.description: Specifies the type of visual variable.

valueExpression.description: An [Arcade expression](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) that computes a value in lieu of a value provided by an attribute `field`.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

examples.title: colorInfo
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing [use of the colorInfo visual variable](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=ed2892fef34b43b8a5cc61c8ff890c6f).

visualVariableLegendOptions_schema.json.title: Visual Variable Legend Options
visualVariableLegendOptions_schema.json.description: Options available for the legend for visual variables.

showLegend.description: Indicates whether to show the color/size/opacity ramp in the legend.

colorStop_schema.json.title: colorStop
colorStop_schema.json.description: A colorStop object describes the renderer's color ramp with more specificity than just colors.

color.description: A CSS color string or an array of rbga values. The color to place at the stop indicated by either a ratio or value.

label.description: Value if a label is needed on the legend for a stop.

value.description: The pixel intensity value. Describes the pixel intensity value that the color should be associated with. Just like in colorInfo, using value will ignore `maxPixelIntensity` and `minPixelIntensity` properties. It will actually set those properties to maximum and minimum values you set in the colorStops array. The hard values are converted to ratios to create the color gradient that is used in the heatmap calculations. Setting `minPixelIntensity` or `maxPixelIntensity`, after setting colorStops with values, removes the hard link between the color ramp and the pixel intensity values that were used to create it.

rotationInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.title: RotationInfo Visual Variable
rotationInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.description: The rotation visual variable defines how features rendered with marker symbols are rotated. The rotation value is determined by a value in a field or an Arcade expression calculating a value. Use either the `field` property or `valueExpression` when specifying rotation values.

axis.description: Defines the rotation axis the visual variable should be applied to when rendering features with an ObjectSymbol3DLayer. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

field.description: Attribute field used for setting the rotation of a symbol if no `valueExpression` is provided.

rotationType.description: Defines the origin and direction of rotation depending on how the angle of rotation was measured. Possible values are `geographic` which rotates the symbol from the north in a clockwise direction and `arithmetic` which rotates the symbol from the east in a counter-clockwise direction.

type.description: A string value indicating the type of visual variable used for the renderer.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade expression] (https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

examples.title: RotationInfo Visual Variable
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing [use of the rotationInfo visual variable](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=30973f38dc5f4e019bf7f4926abd1571).

sizeInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.title: SizeInfo Visual Variable
sizeInfo_visualVariable_schema.json.description: The sizeInfo visual variable defines how size is applied to features based on the values of a numeric field attribute. The minimum and maximum values of the data should be indicated along with their respective size values. You must specify either `minSize` and `maxSize`, or `stops`, or `valueUnit` to construct the size ramp. All features with values falling in between the specified min and max data values (or stops) will be scaled proportionally between the provided min and max sizes.

axis.description: Defines the axis the size visual variable should be applied to when rendering features with an ObjectSymbol3DLayer.

field.description: Attribute field used for size rendering if no valueExpression is provided.

maxSize.description: Specifies the maximum size to be applied to the symbol. This is required if valueUnit is set to `unknown`.

minSize.description: Specifies the minimum size to be applied to the symbol. This is required if valueUnit is set to `unknown`.

normalizationField.description: Attribute field used to normalize the data.

stops.description: An array of objects that defines the thematic size ramp in a sequence of data or expression stops. At least two stops are required. The stops must be listed in ascending order based on the value of the `value` property in each stop. This property is required if `minDataValue`, `maxDataValue`, `minSize`, and `maxSize` are not defined.

target.description: Only used when sizeInfo is used for polygon outlines.

type.description: Specifies the type of visual variable.

useSymbolValue.description: When setting a size visual variable on a renderer using an ObjectSymbol3DLayer, this property indicates whether to apply the value defined by the height, width, or depth properties to the corresponding axis of this visual variable instead of proportionally scaling this axis' value after other axes.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

valueRepresentation.description: Specifies how to apply the data value when mapping real-world sizes. See table below for supported values.

valueUnit.description: A string value indicating the unit of measurement. Defaults to `meters` if not set.

examples.title: sizeInfo
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing [use of the sizeInfo visual variable](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=ed2892fef34b43b8a5cc61c8ff890c6f).

sizeStop_schema.json.title: sizeStop
sizeStop_schema.json.description: A `sizeStop` object describes the size of the symbol at various values of the expression.

label.description: Value if a label is needed on the legend for a stop.

size.description: Specifies the marker size to use for the specified value.

value.description: The value to be mapped to a size.

transparencyInfo_visualVariable_schema.j.title: TransparencyInfo Visual Variable
transparencyInfo_visualVariable_schema.j.description: The transparencyInfo visual variable defines the transparency, or opacity, of each feature's symbol based on a numeric attribute field value.

field.description: Attribute field used for setting the transparency of a feature if no `valueExpression` is provided.

normalizationField.description: Attribute field used to normalize the data.

type.description: Specifies the type of visual variable.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

examples.title: transparencyInfo
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing [use of the transparencyInfo visual variable](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=593dc1e98a1d447fb09b09d486355ef0).

transparencyStop_schema.json.title: transparencyStop
transparencyStop_schema.json.description: The transparencyStop object defines the thematic opacity ramp in a sequence of stops. At least two stops are required. The stops must be listed in ascending order based on the value of the `value` property in each stop.

label.description: A string value used to label the stop in the legend.

transparency.description: A numeric transparancy value for a stop ranging from 0-100, where 0 is opaque and 100 is 100% transparent.

value.description: The pixel intensity value. Describes the pixel intensity value that the color should be associated with.

pointCloudClassBreaksRenderer_schema.jso.title: PointCloud ClassBreaks Renderer
pointCloudClassBreaksRenderer_schema.jso.description: PointCloudClassBreaksRenderer defines the color of each point in a PointCloudLayer based on the value of a numeric attribute. Colors are assigned based on classes or ranges of data. Each point is assigned a symbol based on the class break in which the value of the attribute falls.

colorClassBreakInfos.description: Each element in the array is an object that provides information about a class break associated with the renderer.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

fieldTransformType.description: A transform that is applied to the field value before evaluating the renderer.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

pointsPerInch.description: Number of point to draw per display inch.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

colorClassBreakInfo_schema.json.title: colorClassBreakInfo
colorClassBreakInfo_schema.json.description: The classBreaksInfo object provides information about the class breaks associated with the renderer.

classMaxValue.description: A numeric value used to specify the maximum value for a break.

classMinValue.description: A numeric value used to specify discontinuous class breaks. If this value is null or is missing, the map server will calculate the minimum value based on the preceding class' maximum value.

description.description: String value used to describe the class.

label.description: String value used to label the class.

colorModulationInfo_schema.json.title: colorModulationInfo
colorModulationInfo_schema.json.description: Indicates whether modulation should be used to render the point.

field.description: the attribute to use as a source for the modulation amplitude

maxValue.description: maximum value to compute modulation linear mapping

minValue.description: minimum value to compute modulation linear mapping

pointSizeAlgorithm_schema.json.title: PointCloud Size Algorithm
pointSizeAlgorithm_schema.json.description: Size algorithms for point cloud performance.

pointCloudFixedSizeAlgorithm_schema.json.title: PointCloud FixedSize Algorithm
pointCloudFixedSizeAlgorithm_schema.json.description: Render points with fixed real world or screen space size.

size.description: Symbol size in real world units or display unit

useRealWorldSymbolSizes.description: If true symbol size is in meters, display unit (pt) otherwise

pointCloudSplatAlgorithm_schema.json.title: PointCloud Splat Algorithm
pointCloudSplatAlgorithm_schema.json.description: Render points using sizes depending on point density.

scaleFactor.description: Scale factor to applied to the computed point size (in real world)

pointCloudRGBRenderer_schema.json.title: PointCloud RGB Renderer
pointCloudRGBRenderer_schema.json.description: PointCloudRGBRenderer defines the color of each point in a PointCloudLayer based on the value of a color attribute.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

pointsPerInch.description: Number of point to draw per display inch.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

pointCloudStretchRenderer_schema.json.title: PointCloud Stretch Renderer
pointCloudStretchRenderer_schema.json.description: PointCloudStretchRenderer defines the color of each point in a PointCloudLayer based on the value of a numeric attribute. They allow you to easily map continuous color ramps to minimum and maximum data values of one of the layer's numeric attribute fields.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

fieldTransformType.description: A transform that is applied to the field value before evaluating the renderer.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

pointsPerInch.description: Number of points to draw per display inch.

stops.description: An array of color value pairs.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

pointCloudUniqueValueRenderer_schema.jso.title: PointCloud UniqueValue Renderer
pointCloudUniqueValueRenderer_schema.jso.description: PointCloudUniqueValueRenderer allows you to colorize points in a PointCloudLayer based on an attribute. This is done by using unique colors to represent points with equal attribute values.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

fieldTransformType.description: A transform that is applied to the field value before evaluating the renderer.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

pointsPerInch.description: Number of points to draw per display inch.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

colorUniqueValueInfo_schema.json.title: colorUniqueValueInfo
colorUniqueValueInfo_schema.json.description: The colorUniqueValueInfo object matches a unique value with a specific color.

description.description: String value used to describe the class.

label.description: String value used to label the class.

values.description: List of string values used to classify points.

rasterClassBreaksRenderer_schema.json.title: Raster ClassBreaks Renderer
rasterClassBreaksRenderer_schema.json.description: Defines the color of each raster cell based on the value of a numeric attribute. Colors are assigned based on classed ranges of data.

authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

colorClassBreakInfos.description: Each element in the array is an object that provides information about a class break associated with the renderer.

defaultColor.description: The defaultColor on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

defaultLabel.description: Default label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

normalizationField.description: Used when normalizationType is field. The string value indicating the attribute field by which the data value is normalized.

normalizationTotal.description: Used when normalizationType is percent-of-total, this number property contains the total of all data values.

normalizationType.description: Determine how the data was normalized.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

rasterStretchRenderer_schema.json.title: Raster Stretch Renderer
rasterStretchRenderer_schema.json.description: Displays continuous raster cell values across a gradual ramp of colors. Use this renderer to draw a single band of continuous data. This renderer works well when you have a large range of values to display, such as with imagery or scientific data.

computeGamma.description: Indicates if gamma values should be computed by default.

dra.description: Indicates if Dynamic Range Adjustment should be applied.

numberOfStandardDeviations.description: The number of standard deviations for standard deviation stretch.

sigmoidStrengthLevel.description: Set this from (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

stretchType.description: The stretch types for stretch raster function.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

useGamma.description: Indicates if the renderer applies Gamma stretch.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
For each `stretchType` there are specific sets of requirements that are as follows:
`none`: does not require other parameters.
`standardDeviation`: requires numberOfStandardDeviations, statistics, or dra.
`histogramEqualization`: requires the source dataset to have histograms or additional dra.
`minMax`: requires statistics or dra.
`percentClip`: requires minPercent, maxPercent, and dra.
`sigmoid`: does not require other parameters. Optionally, set the sigmoidStrengthLevel (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

rasterUniqueValueRenderer_schema.json.title: Raster UniqueValue Renderer
rasterUniqueValueRenderer_schema.json.description: Defines the color of each raster cell based on an attribute. This is done by using unique colors to represent cells with equal attribute values.

authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

defaultColor.description: The defaultColor on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

defaultLabel.description: Default label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

simpleRenderer_schema.json.title: Simple Renderer
simpleRenderer_schema.json.description: A simple renderer is a renderer that uses one symbol only.

authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

label.description: The text string that is displayed in the table of contents.

symbol.description: An object that represents how all features will be drawn.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

visualVariables.description: An array of objects used to set rendering properties.

uniqueValueFromStyleRenderer_schema.json.title: UniqueValueFromStyle Renderer
uniqueValueFromStyleRenderer_schema.json.description: This is a special version of UniqueValue Renderer, which loads uniqueValue infos from a style definition.

defaultLabel.description: Default string for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

defaultSymbol.description: The defaultSymbol on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

field1.description: String value specifying the first field used to render matching values.

styleName.description: A registered web style name. Can not be used in conjunction with styleUrl.

styleUrl.description: URL that points to the web style definition. Can not be used in conjunction with styleName.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

visualVariables.description: An array of visualVariable objects used for continuous color or size, simple, and unique values with feature opacity.

uniqueValueRenderer_schema.json.title: UniqueValue Renderer
uniqueValueRenderer_schema.json.description: A unique value renderer symbolizes based on the value of an attribute.

authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

backgroundFillSymbol.description: Used for polygon features. It can only be used for bivariate types and size rendering.

defaultLabel.description: Default label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

defaultSymbol.description: The defaultSymbol on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

field1.description: Attribute field renderer uses to match values.

field2.description: If needed, specify an additional attribute field the renderer uses to match values.

field3.description: If needed, specify an additional attribute field the renderer uses to match values.

fieldDelimiter.description: String inserted between the values if multiple attribute fields are specified.

legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

valueExpression.description: An [Arcade expression](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) evaluating to either a string or a number.

valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

visualVariables.description: An array of objects used to set rendering properties.

uniqueValueInfo_schema.json.title: uniqueValueInfo
uniqueValueInfo_schema.json.description: Info item for the Unique Value Renderer. Its symbol gets selected if the feature's field matches its value.

description.description: String value used to describe the drawn symbol.

label.description: String value used to label the drawn symbol.

symbol.description: An object used to display the value.

value.description: String value indicating the unique value.
